title: Consistent and easy to replicate Vi bug that prevents her from being able to cast Q
body:
Very simply ... if Vi is in the process of casting her Q when she gets snared she will no longer be able to cast it.  The only way to fix this is to restart the client.

It seems to happen about 50% of the time that a snare is cast on Vi during her Q.  I think the problem has something to do with the Q not resetting properly when the second cast does not occur.

This bug has been reported multiple times before and should be easy to identify and fix.

Riot Plz T_T

replies.body: Thanks for posting this and sorry it took me this long to respond.  I'm pretty sure we are aware of this issue and is on our list of things to fix.  When I get in tomorrow I'll poke around a bit more and see if I can either get some progress on the issue or at least provide an update with what is going on.

After messing around with it for a while, simply getting snared while/during/before/etc you are or were casting your Q does not lock it out.  I do know that this is an issue that has happened in the past, but I am curious if you have a more recent video of this happening, as it is otherwise not as easy to reproduce as these steps suggest.

As already posted, if you DO encounter this bug, pressing ALT+Q (the hotkey for self-cast) should fix this issue without needing to restart the client.

Sorry I couldn't be more useful, but I will definitely follow up on this more if there is a recent video of this happening
inb4 you guys "forget" and reply like 2 months later with a "sorry it slipped my mind" like you guys did with the similar Warwick bug just recently.
Thank you. I hadn't spotted a cause when it happened to me.

This has been happening a lot more frequently to me and it doesn't just involve snares. However for me sometimes it seems random - I've had my Q interrupted many times before the second cast by a CC effect (stun, knockup, etc) but it will still work after - however when it does happen, it always seem to do so randomly (sometimes out of combat). However I have not been able to confirm/test it further. Most of the time when it happens it is during a teamfight, but there have been instances where it doesn't seem to be triggered by anything in particular.

To fix it in-game I put Q on smart cast, smart cast it, then take it off smart cast. It's worked every time the bug happened, but it's annoying to have to recall during a teamfight just to fix it.

Riot please look into this, I sent a support ticket to address the issue and saying there isn't a definite timeframe to fix it is kinda a cop-out. The same issue has been around for years, and it's one of the big known glitches (same with Varus and Warwick). It's pretty game-breaking, and I'm getting paranoid about playing her again. Vi's my main and I want to take her into ranked games, and I want to be sure I won't have to throw a match because of a glitch.
